heading: “Regressions and Causal Inference”
text: Welcome site course PS9591: “Regressions Causal Inference” Western University, taught Sebastián Vallejo Vera. week, find code, exercises, slides corresponding topic.start, check required software packages . Also, don’t forget read Syllabus check Perusall readings course. site corrected/updated throughout semester(s).

heading: 0.1 Software and Packages
text: course, using R. assume minimally familiar R language, RStudio, R packages. However, course includes labs coding R. main packages need installed:tidyverse (piping)tidylog (helps keep track pipin’)

heading: 0.2 Datasets
text: Throughout class, using number sample datasets. Access datasets provided directly code. class Final Exam, post required datasets replication exercise :COMING SOON…

heading: 0.4 Final Exam
text: final exam require students replicate findings papers, interpret results.

heading: 0.5 Acknowledgments
text: organization course based great textbook ‘Effect: Introduction Research Design Causality’ Nick Huntington-Klein, freely available . code used throughout main lectures patchwork code, code borrows heavily internet (’s true code). try best give credit original authors code (possible). code labs created revised two amazing doctoral students1 Western University, Hugo Machado John Santos (posted permission).

heading: 1 Hello bookdown
text: chapters start first-level heading followed chapter title, like line . one first-level heading (#) per .Rmd file.

heading: 1.1 A section
text: chapter sections start second-level (##) higher heading followed section title, like sections . can many want within chapter.

heading: An unnumbered section
text: Chapters sections numbered default. un-number heading, add {.unnumbered} shorter {-} end heading, like section.

heading: 2 Cross-references
text: Cross-references make easier readers find link elements book.

heading: 2.1 Chapters and sub-chapters
text:
two steps cross-reference heading:Label heading: # Hello world {#nice-label}.
Leave label like automated heading generated based heading title: example, # Hello world = # Hello world {#hello-world}.
label un-numbered heading, use: # Hello world {-#nice-label} {# Hello world .unnumbered}.
Leave label like automated heading generated based heading title: example, # Hello world = # Hello world {#hello-world}.label un-numbered heading, use: # Hello world {-#nice-label} {# Hello world .unnumbered}.Next, reference labeled heading anywhere text using \@ref(nice-label); example, please see Chapter 2.
prefer text link instead numbered reference use: text want can go .
prefer text link instead numbered reference use: text want can go .

heading: 2.2 Captioned figures and tables
text:
Figures tables captions can also cross-referenced elsewhere book using \@ref(fig:chunk-label) \@ref(tab:chunk-label), respectively.See Figure 2.1.
Figure 2.1: nice figure!
Don’t miss Table 2.1.Table 2.1: nice table!
code:
par(mar = c(4, 4, .1, .1))
plot(pressure, type = 'b', pch = 19)
knitr::kable(
  head(pressure, 10), caption = 'Here is a nice table!',
  booktabs = TRUE
)

heading: 3 Parts
text: can add parts organize one book chapters together. Parts can inserted top .Rmd file, first-level chapter heading file.Add numbered part: # (PART) Act one {-} (followed # chapter)Add unnumbered part: # (PART\*) Act one {-} (followed # chapter)Add appendix special kind un-numbered part: # (APPENDIX) stuff {-} (followed # chapter). Chapters appendix prepended letters instead numbers.

heading: 4.1 Footnotes
text: Footnotes put inside square brackets caret ^[]. Like one 2.

heading: 4.2 Citations
text:
Reference items bibliography file(s) using @key.example, using bookdown package (Xie 2023) (check last code chunk index.Rmd see citation key added) sample book, built top R Markdown knitr (Xie 2015) (citation added manually external file book.bib).
Note .bib files need listed index.Rmd YAML bibliography key.RStudio Visual Markdown Editor can also make easier insert citations: https://rstudio.github.io/visual-markdown-editing/#/citations

heading: 5.1 Equations
5.2 Theorems and proofs
text:
Labeled theorems can referenced text using \@ref(thm:tri), example, check smart theorem 5.1.Theorem 5.1  right triangle, \(c\) denotes length hypotenuse
\(\) \(b\) denote lengths two sides, 
\[^2 + b^2 = c^2\]Read https://bookdown.org/yihui/bookdown/markdown-extensions--bookdown.html.

heading: 5.3 Callout blocks
text: R Markdown Cookbook provides help use custom blocks design callouts: https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown-cookbook/custom-blocks.html

heading: 6.1 Publishing
text: HTML books can published online, see: https://bookdown.org/yihui/bookdown/publishing.html

heading: 6.2 404 pages
text: default, users directed 404 page try access webpage found. ’d like customize 404 page instead using default, may add either _404.Rmd _404.md file project root use code /Markdown syntax.

heading: 6.3 Metadata for sharing
text: Bookdown HTML books provide HTML metadata social sharing platforms like Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, using information provide index.Rmd YAML. setup, set url book path cover-image file. book’s title description also used.gitbook uses social sharing data across chapters book- links shared look .Specify book’s source repository GitHub using edit key configuration options _output.yml file, allows users suggest edit linking chapter’s source file.Read features output format :https://pkgs.rstudio.com/bookdown/reference/gitbook.htmlOr use:
